name: Europe External Programme with Africa
goal:
Europe External Programme with Africa strives to ensure that justice, equality and accountability are key cornerstones in the pursuit of international relations. Emphasis is given to Europe’s engagement with and impact on Africa and the role played by the European Union’s external action. EEPA’s approach seeks to recognise the core principles enshrined in the EU’s Treaties to promote democratic governance and accountability, adhere to the rule of law including human rights obligations, and enable societies and their people to live in dignity free from discrimination of any kind.

EEPA’s focus gives an emphasis to countries in the Horn of Africa and North Africa. Through research, analysis, advocacy, information collection and dissemination, and in working with actors in the region it strives to increase knowledge and understanding around topics such as human trafficking, human rights abuses and migration. In doing so is seeks to contribute to processes that improve the lives of people in Africa and in the diaspora in Europe. EEPA strives to empower diaspora communities in Europe and to help Africa’s citizens, refugees and migrants in countries of origin, transit countries and host countries. EEPA’s work gives focus to human trafficking, human rights, gender equality, migration and refugee rights.
interests: Development, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Home Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Justice and Fundamental Rights
euInitiatives:
EU external policies
Development funding and policies under the DCI and EDF
EU response to human trafficking, predominantly in Africa
Cotonou agreement and negotiations
EU policies with regards to the Horn of Africa countries
